header_text: Courthouse Escalator 415 (Airport/Design Center platform to lobby) unavailable due to ongoing construction at the station.
Courthouse Escalator 417 (Airport/Design Center platform to south lobby) unavailable due to ongoing construction at the station.

Lynn Parking Garage arcade stairs 1 and 2 are closed until further notice due to structural issues. Customers may exit the garage via elevators to the ground level or by using the south stairs located on the Market street side of the garage.
description_text: Vehicular access to the upper 2 levels of the garage is restricted. The garage has sufficient parking capacity to accommodate daily demand.

header_text: The Upper Parking Lot at Worcester Station is closed with the exception to accessible parking, due to construction.
Bowdoin Escalator 125 (Lobby to street) is unavailable until further notice pending replacement.
description_text:
The escalator will remain out of service for the foreseeable future. This decision was made after a thorough inspection determined that corrosion on the escalator’s steel truss was so severe that it could not be repaired further and that a complete replacement of the escalator would be required. Replacing the escalator at this location requires a more extended unit meeting modern escalator safety requirements. This longer unit will require significant alteration to the station entrance to meet code requirements. The MBTA has currently begun design work to understand what station upgrades will be needed. 
  
Due to these complexities, we expect the escalator will remain out of service for a significant time. We recognize the challenges this poses to our riders, and please know we are working to identify a solution as quickly as possible. In the meantime, Government Center Station, which is fully accessible and serves the Blue Line, is under a quarter-mile from Bowdoin Station.

header_text: Andrew Escalator 123 (Ashmont/Braintree platform to busway) is unavailable until further notice pending replacement.
The Riverside Ave entrance at Campello Station is currently closed. Passengers may continue to use the Plain St entrance.
description_text:

Fall River/New Bedford Line

header_text: Oak Grove Escalator 105 (Commuter Rail platform to unpaid lobby) unavailable

Hingham/Hull Ferry: Portions of the Town of Hull parking lot at the Hull ferry terminal are blocked off for sewer pump station construction work. More information is available at https://www.town.hull.ma.us/
Littleton/Route 495 passengers can expect occasional traffic and detours accessing the station due to the Foster Street reconstruction work.
description_text: Scheduled to complete sometime in 2027, the Reconstruction of Foster Street includes widening and resurfacing with the addition of bicycle lanes.

header_text: There is no accessible path connecting the inbound and outbound platforms at Wellesley Square Station. The existing path includes steep slopes and is long. Designs are underway to provide for a fully compliant pathway.
description_text: There are accessible mini-high platforms at the Western end of both the Track 1 and Track 2 sides. However, the existing pedestrian path between the two sides is long and includes steep slopes, especially on the Crest Road bridge over the tracks. Designs are underway to provide for a fully compliant pathway.

Jackson Square: The stairway connecting the Jackson Sq lobby and the south end of the platform is closed until winter 2026. Use the stairway at the north end of the platform. This closure is for the construction of a new stairway and a second elevator.
To accommodate Providence Station Renovations, construction barriers have been installed and the Southern stairwell to Track 1 is out of service. Staircase access to Track 3 and Track 5 are now open.

header_text: The Amtrak infrastructure repairs have been completed and starting Monday, January 19th, Franklin/Foxboro Line trains will resume operating according to the Fall/Winter schedule.
description_text:
Schedule available soon at mbta.com/cr.

On MLK Day, Monday 1/19, All commuter rail trains will operate on a regular weekday schedule.

Shuttle buses will continue to be provided with extended mid-day service (9:30 am -4:30 pm) between Walpole and Foxboro as construction at Foxboro Station continues.

Certain Foxboro trains will be restored between South Station & Walpole, with connecting bus service to Foxboro.

Weekday trains will resume operating via Back Bay.

Weekend trains will resume operating via Fairmount.

header_text: Jackson Square: The platform is undergoing renovations to improve safety and accessibility. Sections of the platform are unlevel, which may make it difficult for some riders to board and exit trains.
description_text: Please see station personnel or use a station call box to request assistance.

header_text: Blue Line: There will be no train service between Bowdoin & Airport the weekend of January 24 - 25 for maintenance work. Shuttle buses will replace service between Airport and Downtown. Riders downtown can board Airport shuttles at Haymarket.
description_text:
Additional Travel Time:
Riders using shuttle buses should budget extra time. For example, a rider traveling to Government Center from Wonderland should budget at least an additional 30 – 40 minutes of travel in additional to their regular commute.  

Shuttle Buses:
Free and accessible shuttle buses will make stops at Airport, Maverick, and Haymarket on the Green and Orange lines.

Shuttle Stops:

Airport:
Transportation Way @ Service Rd (Route 104 drop-off)

Maverick:
Maverick Sq @ Maverick Station

Haymarket:
Drop-off: Surface Rd @ Hanover St
Pick-up: Congress St @ Haymarket Station

Downtown Connections:
There will be no direct shuttle bus service to/from Bowdoin, Government Center (for connections to the Green Line), State (for connections to the Orange Line), or Aquarium.    

Accessible Vans:
Accessible vans will be available for direct service to Government, Haymarket, Aquarium, and State. Vans can be requested by MBTA personnel or by a station call box.

header_text: Red Line: Shuttle buses will replace service between Broadway and North Quincy & Broadway and Ashmont the weekend of January 31 - February 1, for track work. This is to allow for upgrading and testing of the signal system.
description_text:
Additional Travel Time:
Riders using shuttle buses should budget extra time. For example, a rider traveling to Downtown Crossing from Ashmont should budget at least an additional 40 minutes of travel in additional to their regular commute.  

Commuter Rail Alternatives:
Riders are strongly encouraged to use the Fall River/New Bedford, Kingston, and Greenbush (Old Colony) Commuter Rail lines for fare-free service between Braintree, Quincy Center, JFK/UMass, and South Station. Regular fares will be collected for trips beyond Braintree.

Accessibility:
Accessible van service will be available between the Savin Hill headhouse and the shuttle stop, and between Broadway and Ashmont. Vans can be requested by MBTA personnel or by a station call box.

Shuttle Locations:

Broadway:
W. Broadway @ Broadway Station

Andrew:
Northbound - Dorchester Ave @ Leeds St
Southbound - Dorchester Ave @ Dexter St

JFK/UMass:
All shuttles - Outer Busway

North Quincy:
North Quincy Station Garage

header_text: On the weekends of Jan 3rd-4th, 17th-18th and 31st-Feb.1st, Orange Line service will replace regular weekend train service on the Haverhill Line between North Station and Oak Grove to allow for signal improvement work.
description_text:
-A diversion schedule will be in effect.

-Passengers can use the Orange Line for service between North Station and Oak Grove. 

-There will be normal Commuter Rail weekend train service between Oak Grove and Haverhill.

-There will be no shuttle buses provided for this diversion.

-Riders using the Orange Line should budget extra travel time. For example, a rider traveling to North Station from Oak Grove should budget at least 10 minutes of travel in addition to their regular trip time.

header_text: On the weekends of Jan 3rd-4th, 17th-18th and 31st-Feb.1st, local and express shuttle buses replace regular weekend train service on the Lowell Line between North Station and Anderson/Woburn to allow for signal improvement work.
description_text:
- A diversion schedule will be in effect. 

- An express shuttle will operate nonstop between North Station and Anderson/Woburn.

- A local shuttle will operate between North Station and Anderson/Woburn, making all local stops. 

-Riders using the shuttle buses should budget extra travel time. For example, a rider traveling to North Station from Anderson/Woburn should budget up to 15 minutes additional travel on the express shuttle and up to 40 minutes additional travel on the local shuttle.

Shuttle bus pick up/drop off locations:

NORTH STATION: Nashua St @ Red Auerbach Way

WEST MEDFORD: Inbound – High St @ Canal St (MBTA Routes 94, 95, & 326 bus stop)
                                Outbound – High St @ Warren St (MBTA Routes 94, 95, & 326 bus stop)

WEDGEMERE: Wedgemere Station Parking Lot (inbound side)

WINCHESTER CENTER: Laraway Rd @ Winchester Center Station (MBTA Route 134 bus stop)

ANDERSON/WOBURN: Anderson/Woburn Station Busway (adjacent to Logan Express bus

header_text: On the weekends of Jan 3rd-4th, 17th-18th and 31st-Feb.1st, local and express shuttle buses replace regular weekend train service on the Newburyport/Rockport Line between North Station and Swampscott to allow for signal improvement work.
description_text:
-A diversion schedule will be in effect. 

-An express shuttle will operate nonstop between North Station and Swampscott. 

-A local shuttle will operate between North Station and Swampscott, making all local stops.

-Riders using the shuttle buses should budget extra travel time. For example, a rider traveling to North Station from Swampscott should budget up to 40 minutes additional travel on the express shuttle and up to 70 minutes additional travel on the local shuttle.

Shuttle bus pick-up/drop-off locations:

NORTH STATION: Nashua St @ Red Auerbach Way

CHELSEA: Inbound, Everett Ave @ Vale St (MBTA Route 112 bus stop). Outbound, Everett Ave @ Maple St (MBTA Route 112 bus stop).

WONDERLAND: Wonderland Blue Line Station Busway (behind Berth E)

LYNN: Lynn Station Busway Berth #1 (MBTA Routes 441 & 442 bus stop)

SWAMPSCOTT: Railroad Ave @ Swampscott Station

header_text: On the weekends of Jan 3rd-4th, 17th-18th and 31st-Feb.1st, Red & Green Line service will replace regular weekend train service on the Fitchburg Line between North Station and Porter to allow for signal improvement work.
description_text:
- A diversion schedule will be in effect. 

- Passengers can use the Red Line for travel between Porter and Park St.

- Passengers can use the Green Line for travel between Park St and North Station. 

- Passengers traveling to/from North Station should budget extra travel time. For example, a rider traveling to North Station from Porter should budget at least 20 minutes of travel in addition to their regular trip time.

header_text: On Saturday, January 31 & Sunday, February 1, there will be no Commuter Rail service between Needham Heights and South Station on the Needham Line. Passengers can use MBTA buses, Orange, and Green Line service as alternatives.
description_text:
-There will be no shuttle bus service alternatives or diversion schedule for this service change.
-Passengers may use Bus Routes 35, 36, and 37 between West Roxbury and Forest Hills for connections to Orange Line subway service between Forest Hills and Back Bay.
-Passengers may use Bus Route 59 between Needham Junction and Newton Highlands for connections to Green Line D branch subway service to Copley, which is less than a quarter mile away (or about a four-minute walk) from Back Bay.
-There will be no service at Hersey.
-Riders using Bus Routes 35, 36, 37, or 59 should budget extra travel time. For example, a rider traveling to South Station from West Roxbury should budget at least 35 minutes of travel in addition to their regular trip time.
-This allows for West Roxbury Parkway Bridge Replacement project, which will replace the bridge that carries the West Roxbury Parkway over the Needham Line.

header_text: Chinatown Elevator 876 (Oak Grove platform to Washington St, Essex St) unavailable due to maintenance
description_text:
To exit: get off the train at Tufts Medical Center. Go to the Washington St exit. At street level, cross Washington St. Take a Silver Line SL4 (South Station) or SL5 (Downtown) bus to Washington St and Essex St (Chinatown Station). Alternatively, if possible, travel 0.2 miles north on Washington St to Chinatown Station.


To board: go to the Silver Line SL5 bus stop at Washington St and Essex St. Take an SL5 (Downtown) bus to Tufts Medical Center (stay on bus past the Temple Pl stop).
Alternate route: travel 0.2 miles south on Washington St to Tufts Medical Center.

header_text: Fare gates at South Station have begun being activated incrementally. Riders will need to tap or scan to exit and enter the track area. Visit MBTA.com/CRGATES for more information.

Fare gates at South Station have begun being activated incrementally. Riders may need to tap/scan to exit & enter the track area. CharlieCard users: validate cards at South Station vending machine or with conductor.
description_text:
-Extra staff will be onsite to assist. 
-Visit MBTA.com/CRGATES for more information.
-Fairmount Line riders paying with a CharlieCard must validate their fare before entering or exiting the fare gates. 
-If your trip begins at South Station, validate your CharlieCard at the fare vending machines near the station's ticket office. You'll then be able to tap your CharlieCard at the gate. 
-If your trip ends at South Station, you'll need to see a conductor onboard or staff on the station platform to get an exit ticket. You'll scan this ticket at a reader to exit the gate. 
-Fairmount Line Zone 1A stations will receive new Fare Vending Machines for CharlieCard validation for Commuter Rail use.

To exit the train when traveling on an Oak Grove-bound train, exit the right side of the train onto the Oak Grove platform and use Sullivan Elevator 881. To board a Forest Hills-bound train, use Sullivan Elevator 881 to access the Oak Grove platform, then wait for an Oak Grove-bound train to arrive. When the train arrives, cross through the train over to the center platform.
